comment._content: Reminds me of the Royal Pavilion in Brighton... Are they connected somehow?

comment.author: 21133841@N03
comment._content: I wonder what happened to it?  I remember trips to Gravesend on the ferry from Tilbury when I was a child but dont  ever remember seeing this wonderful building.

comment.author: 63050242@N06
comment._content: I've recently been researching Clifton Baths because three of my ancestors (father, son and grandson) were proprietors - John Lewis Lukes, Thomas Lewis Lukes and Charles Andrew Lukes in the mid/late 1800s. There is a connection between the design of the Gravesend Baths and the Brighton Pavilion. The baths were rebuilt in 1836 and were designed by archtect Amon Henry Wilds. The domes and minarets echoed those Wilds used in teh design of his home in Brighton (the Western Pavilion) and the style was influenced by the Royal Pavilion in Brighton designed by John Nash.

comment.author: 14343849@N05
comment._content: Very fanciful...is it a place you can stay now?
